criticism: The function 'mul' takes two uint256 parameters 'a' and 'b'. If 'a' is large enough, the multiplication of 'a' and 'b' may result in an integer overflow. This can lead to incorrect results or even loss of funds.
The function 'div' takes two uint256 parameters 'a' and 'b'. If 'b' is zero, the division operation will result in a division by zero error. This can lead to incorrect results or even loss of funds.

The function 'sub' takes two uint256 parameters 'a' and 'b'. If 'b' is larger than 'a', the subtraction operation will result in an underflow error. This can lead to incorrect results or even loss of funds.

The function 'add' takes two uint256 parameters 'a' and 'b'. If the sum of 'a' and 'b' exceeds the maximum value that can be represented by a uint256, the addition operation will result in an overflow error. This can lead to incorrect results or even loss of funds.

The function 'distr' calls the 'distr' function of the 'Primeo' contract. However, the return value of the 'distr' function is not checked. If the 'distr' function fails, the 'distr' function will not be able to handle the error and the contract may become stuck.

The function 'getTokens' calls the 'distr' function of the 'Primeo' contract. However, the return value of the 'distr' function is not checked. If the 'distr' function fails, the 'getTokens' function will not be able to handle the error and the contract may become stuck.

The function 'transferFrom' calls the 'transferFrom' function of the 'ERC20' contract. However, the return value of the 'transferFrom' function is not checked. If the 'transferFrom' function fails, the 'transferFrom' function will not be able to handle the error and the contract may become stuck.

The function 'approve' calls the 'approve' function of the 'ERC20' contract. However, the return value of the 'approve' function is not checked. If the 'approve' function fails, the 'approve' function will not be able to handle the error and the contract may become stuck.

The function 'burn' calls the 'burn' function of the 'ERC20' contract. However, the return value of the 'burn' function is not checked. If the 'burn' function fails, the 'burn' function will not be able to handle the error and the contract may become stuck.
